content:
I am a data scientist working at the Global AI Accelerator (GAIA) within Ericsson. I currently work on applying machine learning to problems within telecommunications, such as incorporating casual inference and reinforcement learning in predicting the performance of networks.
Previously, I had the privilege of doing research in multiple robotics labs at Berkeley: Human-Assistive Robotic Technologies Lab under Prof. Ruzena Bajcsy, Biomimetic Millisystems Lab under Prof. Ron Fearing, and the InterACT Lab under Prof. Anca Dragan.
summary:

title: Ravi Pandya
Nonverbal Robot Feedback for Human Teachers
Nonverbal Robot Feedback for Human Teachers

summary: Designed circuits and PCBs for motor drivers, encoders, and a line camera; wrote sensing and controls code to autonomously navigate a complicated track.
title: Line-Following Car

summary: Analyzed the robustness of nonlinear controllers (Feedback Linearizing, Adaptive, Computed Torque, Sliding Mode) under disturbances and model misspecification for a 2DOF Matlab simulated robot arm and a 7DOF Kinova Jaco in a C++ ROS framework utilizing Gazebo.
title: Robustness Analysis of Nonlinear Controllers
Human-AI Learning Performance in Multi-Armed Bandits
Learning Image-Conditioned Dynamics Models for Under-actuated Legged Millirobots

summary: Wrote software for sensing, planning and control of Baxter Robot to allow it to intelligently play a gameof checkers against a human.
title: Checkers-Playing Robot

content:
Books/Series I've read recently [does listening to an audiobook count as reading? I say yes]
The Kingkiller Chronicles (The Name of the Wind & The Wise Man's Fear) - Patrick Rothfuss  Not as much action as expected for a fantasy novel, but the world and magic system are some of the most interesting and coherent I've seen. Apparently book 3 will come out August 2020? We shall see.  The Rook Files (The Rook & Stiletto) - Daniel O'Malley  The writing itself is really witty/funny all the way through, but not at the expense of high stakes. The premise of a magical British Secret Service is really fun. I await book 3!  Sphere - Michael Crichton  A pretty classic sci-fi book that asks some big questions about humanity and morality.  Favorites/Recommendations  Harry Potter Percy Jackson & The Olympians I am now realizing I didn't read very many books in high school or college
summary:
Books/Series I've read recently [does listening to an audiobook count as reading? I say yes]
The Kingkiller Chronicles (The Name of the Wind & The Wise Man's Fear) - Patrick Rothfuss  Not as much action as expected for a fantasy novel, but the world and magic system are some of the most interesting and coherent I've seen. Apparently book 3 will come out August 2020? We shall see.  The Rook Files (The Rook & Stiletto) - Daniel O'Malley  The writing itself is really witty/funny all the way through, but not at the expense of high stakes.

content:
Games I've played recently [this is a very casual list of games I've played and songs I've enjoyed, not real reviews]
Persona 5 The Royal In an effort to continuing learning Japanese, I picked up a physical copy of the game while I was at CoRL 2019!
 Favorite Songs:  Whims of Fate Super funky, super underrated Groovy Incredible until the strings come in Take Over Swear to My Bones So much emotion in this one    Pokemon Sword A solid and streamlined Pokemon experience. Not much in the way of story, but who plays for the story?
 Favorite Songs  Bede Battle Theme Hop Final Battle Theme Turffield Theme Marnie Battle Theme    Fire Emblem: Three Houses I had never played fire emblem before this, but playing this game has convinced me I should have.
 Favorite Songs  Edge of Dawn This is sung from Edelgard's perspective–in Japanese, the song is called フレスベルグの少女 or “The Girl of Hresvelg” Fodlan Winds Apex of the World    Favorites/Recommendations  Super Smash Bros Ultimate The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Celeste Super Mario Odyssey Hollow Knight Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze Pokemon Black/White Super Mario Galaxy/Super Mario Galaxy 2
summary:
Games I've played recently [this is a very casual list of games I've played and songs I've enjoyed, not real reviews]
Persona 5 The Royal In an effort to continuing learning Japanese, I picked up a physical copy of the game while I was at CoRL 2019!
 Favorite Songs:  Whims of Fate Super funky, super underrated Groovy Incredible until the strings come in Take Over Swear to My Bones So much emotion in this one    Pokemon Sword A solid and streamlined Pokemon experience.

content: Shows I've watched recently Psycho-Pass (1 & 2)  A likeable protagonist with a real personality. Also asks a lot of big questions about what it means to be moral or perfect; all-around a great show with great characters and an enticing story.  His Dark Materials  I read the original trilogy a very long time ago, so I don't remember many details, but this show has continued to keep me interested in both the world and characters.  Steins;gate 0  I would usually lump this with its predecessor but what makes this show great is not what makes the original so great. I love this show for its character moments, it was great to see all my favorites get more development and screen time. The end of episode 8 was more than enough to get me emotional.  Better Call Saul  This show is a certainly not as action-filled as most shows I find myself watching, but that doesn't mean it's slow-paced. This show knows how to raise the stakes with the relationships between characters and how to make decisions feel like they matter. We know how it's going to end, but the journey is what's interesting. To top it off, some of the best cinematography I've ever encountered.  Favorites/Recommendations Steins;gate  One of the rare time-travel stories to both have high stakes but be small-scale. The characters are all super lovable, and the questions it poses about what the “right” decisions are what it means for the future have no easy answers. There are few stories I love more than this one.  Breaking Bad Avatar: The Last Airbender The Legend of Korra Demon Slayer Mob Psycho 100 (I & II)
summary: Shows I've watched recently Psycho-Pass (1 & 2)  A likeable protagonist with a real personality. Also asks a lot of big questions about what it means to be moral or perfect; all-around a great show with great characters and an enticing story.  His Dark Materials  I read the original trilogy a very long time ago, so I don't remember many details, but this show has continued to keep me interested in both the world and characters.
